definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: Soliciting a scarlet woman in China can be a serious crime.
sentences.chinese: 在中国大陆拉皮条，可能是重罪。

sentences.english: He became well known for pandering to any man who needed a woman.
sentences.chinese: 他以给人拉皮条而臭名昭著。

sentences.english: For many years David lived an evil life, pandering to men's sexual's desires.
sentences.chinese: 多年来大卫一直过着邪恶的生活，为男人拉皮条。

sentences.english: And I am not pimping you out.
Kill more chinks, free thai women pimped by chinese men.
sentences.chinese: 多杀点中国佬，解放被中国男人拉皮条的泰国女人。

sentences.english: But I really and honestly feel that we're pandering.
sentences.chinese: 但我真的觉得我们像是拉皮条的。

sentences.english: He made an immoral living procuring women for tourists in the city.
sentences.chinese: 他靠为旅客拉皮条而过着见不得人的生活。

definition: to force an honest girl into prostitution (idiom)/to debauch
to work as a good-time girl/to prostitute oneself
see 拉皮條|拉皮条[la1 pi2 tiao2]
to work as a hostess in a bar or KTV
